setAsDefault.title: Set as Default confirmation
setAsDefault.question: Do you want to install the policy as Default?

info.description: Specify the type of policy you that want to create.  Organizational policies can be used to protect your organization's proprietary information. Regulatory policies can be used to protect sensitive information related to industry or government regulations.
info.regulatoryDesc: When multiple regulatory policies conflict for a user, BlackBerry will automatically reconcile these policies by applying the most restrictive elements of all policies. The minimum number of data occurrences will be selected and the most restrictive remediation action will be applied.
info.organizationalDesc: When multiple organizational policies conflict for a user, BlackBerry will automatically reconcile these policies by applying the least restrictive elements of all policies. The maximum number of data occurrences will be selected, and the least restrictive remediation action will be applied.

conditions.title: Conditions
conditions.description: Define the sensitive data that you want to protect and the conditions that will trigger a policy violation.  You can start by using one of the templates you selected from the <0>Avert settings</0> or create your own custom policy.

addFromTemplateDialog.title: Add from template
addFromTemplateDialog.description: Select a template from the list below to automatically add the sensitive data you want to protect.
addFromTemplateDialog.noTemplatesDescription: You have not added any templates.  Go to the <0>Avert settings</0> to add predefined templates to your list.

confirmation.title: Template confirmation
confirmation.description: Adding a new template will override existing conditions.

occurrences.rangeText: The value must be between 1 and 10.

whitelist.title: Allowed Domains
whitelist.name: Domain
whitelist.paragraph: Specify which browser domains can be trusted to safely upload files from the list you created in <0>Avert Settings</0>. The policy will not be applied to allowed domains.

emailSettings.title: Allowed Email Domains
emailSettings.description: Specify which email recipients can be trusted when sharing sensitive data based on the list of allowed internal email domains you created in the <0>Avert Settings</0>.
emailSettings.helperText: Detect when sensitive content is shared by email.

actions.title: Actions
actions.description: Specify what action to take when the policy conditions are detected.

policyConfigNames.CONFIG_TYPE_ALLOW_COPY_BB_APPS_INTO_NON_: Allow copying data from BlackBerry Spark apps to non BlackBerry Spark apps
policyConfigNames.CONFIG_TYPE_ALLOW_COPY_NON_BB_APPS_INTO_: Allow copying data between BlackBerry Spark apps
policyConfigNames.CONFIG_TYPE_ALLOW_INSECURE_VIDEO: Allow screen capture and insecure video output
policyConfigNames.CONFIG_TYPE_ALLOW_SCREEN_RECORDING: Allow screen capture recording and sharing

componentHeader.paragraph: Avert content policies are used to detect your organization's sensitive data and protect against unauthorized sharing. If multiple policies conflict for a user, BlackBerry will automatically reconcile based on policy type.
Mobile settings apply to all device types unless otherwise specified. If more than one policy is assigned to a user, the highest ranked policy is applied.
